program.name: ipmitool
program.configure:
case "${SB_SYSTYPE}" in *-aix*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mcpu=powerpc" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-blibpath:" LDFLAGS="-Wl,-brtl -Wl,-blibpath:/usr/lib"
ARGS="--disable-intf-imb" ;; ia64*-hpux*) CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+b,"
ARGS="--disable-intf-imb" ;; *-hpux*) CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+s,+b,"
ARGS="--disable-intf-imb" ;; *-irix*) CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; i?86*-linux*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mtune=pentiumpro -march=pentiumpro" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; *-linux*) CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; i?86*-solaris*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mtune=pentium4 -march=pentium4" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; *-solaris*) CFLAGS="-O2 -mcpu=ultrasparc -mvis" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; esac
${SHELL} ./configure CC="${CC:-gcc}" CFLAGS="${CFLAGS:--O2}" \ CPPFLAGS="${SB_VAR_LIBOPENSSL+-I${SB_VAR_LIBOPENSSL_INC}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+-I${SB_VAR_NCURSES_INC} -I${SB_VAR_NCURSES_INC}/ncurses} \ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+-I${SB_VAR_READLINE_INC}}" \ LDFLAGS="${SB_VAR_GCC_RT+-L${SB_VAR_GCC_RT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+-L${SB_VAR_NCURSES_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBOPENSSL+-L${SB_VAR_LIBOPENSSL_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+-L${SB_VAR_READLINE_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_GCC_RT+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_GCC_RT_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_LIBOPENSSL+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_LIBOPENSSL_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_NCURSES+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_NCURSES_LIB}} \ ${SB_VAR_READLINE+${CC_LD_RT}${SB_VAR_READLINE_LIB}} \ ${LDFLAGS+${LDFLAGS}}" --enable-ipmishell \ --disable-dependency-tracking --docdir=${_docdir} \ --localstatedir=${_localstatedir} \ --mandir="${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/man" ${ARGS+${ARGS}} \ --prefix=${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}
${SB_PATH_SED} -i -e "\ s!/var/run!${_localstatedir}/run!;" doc/ipmievd.8

item.para: Apply patch for CVE-2011-4339 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4339). ipmievd (aka the IPMI event daemon) in OpenIPMI uses 0666 permissions for its ipmievd.pid PID file, which allows local users to kill arbitrary processes by writing to this file.
